alert.note: Alert for Kay; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:30PM CDT until June 17 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR EASTERN KAY...EASTERN NOBLE AND NORTHERN PAYNE COUNTIES... At 1129 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Hardy to 6 miles north of Coyle, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Ponca City, Newkirk, Morrison, Glencoe, Kaw City, Kildare, Kaw Lake, Lake Mcmurtry, Hardy, Quay, Sooner Lake, and Lake Carl Blackwell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
